meanings.definition: Enlarged or distended in size or volume
meanings.sent1: The swollen balloon was ready to burst.
meanings.sent2: Her ankle was swollen after she twisted it.
meanings.sent3: The swollen watermelon looked like it had a secret.
meanings.sent4: The swollen river overflowed its banks after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The swollen clouds signaled an impending storm.

meanings.sent1: The swollen cheeks made her look like a chipmunk.
meanings.sent2: The bread dough was swollen from the yeast.
meanings.sent3: The swollen balloon animal looked like a chubby version of itself.
meanings.sent4: The swollen ego of the actor was evident in his demands.
meanings.sent5: The swollen sponge soaked up all the spilled milk.

meanings.definition: Inflamed or irritated, as a body part or tissue
meanings.sent1: Her swollen eyes showed she had been crying.
meanings.sent2: The swollen mosquito bite itched terribly.
meanings.sent3: The swollen toe seemed to have a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: His swollen temper caused unnecessary arguments.
meanings.sent5: The swollen rash spread quickly across her skin.
